p: Country‐specific, epidemic‐specific, and regional estimates for the yields (number of individuals needed to be tested to identify one chronically infected individual) of potential testing programs targeting the different epidemiologic populations were derived using the inverse of the pooled mean risk of having been exposed to HCV. 28 In this derivation, a spontaneous clearance rate of 25% was assumed based on estimates from prospective cohort studies. 60, 61 Of note, a recent modeling study suggested that the HCV spontaneous clearance rate may have been underestimated in prospective cohort studies. 62
